lab.fatcat.com giolab.local fatcat.com

Location_Notes: This Location section includes the following classifications of machines:
* _NOT_ PGT Legacy iCenter systems (as defined in the iCenter section)
* PGT Legacy eCenter systems (i.e. those that meet the following criteria):
* Use PGT Legacy Site Code E _without_ PGT Legacy Environment code L
* Do not use PGT Legacy Environment code L
* Reside in either Lewisville USLJVxx or Irving USIRTxx (aka Irvingville, the Irving/Lewisville stretch-network)
* Consist primarily of Lower assets (though some Upper assets may be included)
* PGT Legacy Lewisville systems (i.e. those that meet the following criteria):
* Use PGT Legacy Site Code L
* Consist primarily of Upper assets (though possibly a few Lower assets may be included)
* New-Name systems (both Upper and Lower) that formally reside in Lewisville USLJVxx

Locations.LocationName: iCenter (aka Legacy PGT PerfLab aka Legacy Norcross iCenter)
Location_Notes: This Location section represents the PGT Legacy Norcross iCenter, consisting of machines that meet the following criteria:
* Use PGT Legacy Site Code I, or use PGT Legacy Site Code E _with_ PGT Legacy Environment code L
* Reside entirely within Irving USIRTxx (but are sometimes regarded as living in Irvingville, the Irving/Lewisville stretch-network)
* Originated historically within the PGT Legacy Norcross iCenter (which is now a logical entity within Irving USIRTxx)
* Reside in the PGT Legacy PerfLab Network Space (i.e. CIDR xx.xxx.x.x/xx)
* Consist solely of Lower (PerfLab) assets
Since the xxxx JADE Migration, PGT Legacy Norcross iCenter is a logical entity contained entirely within physical Irving USIRTxx.
However, iCenter workload shall be filed under Lewisville USLJVxx, rather than Irving USIRTxx, in the Service Mapping file.
This filing decision is for reasons of organization:
(x) so that all PGT Legacy Lower environments are grouped under Lewisville rather than Irving;
(x) so that Lab-related workloads are handled in a separate Location section from non-Lab-related workloads,
in order to prevent a x-Lab section from having to OVERRIDE properties in an All or x-Lower section (which is not allowed by the parser).
If, in the future, Irving USIRTxx begins servicing new/go-forward Lower environments, the USIRTxx JSON section will be augmented to handle that workload.
